intro: Galium saurense, commonly known as the marsh bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pinkish flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium saurense typically thrives in moist, shady environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
